SEARCH
Module com.example.romeandvikings
Package com.example.romeandvikings.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.romeandvikings.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GameController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The GameController class is responsible for managing the game logic and user interactions in a Rome-themed conquest game.

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameController()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    attackAction()
    The function "attackAction" checks if a certain number of radio buttons are selected, performs some calculations based on the selected values, updates a label, and calls another function if a certain condition is met.
    boolean
    checkAmountRadioButtonsSelected()
    The function checks if a certain number of radio buttons are selected and displays an error message if the condition is not met.
    void
    consultAction()
    The function consultAction checks if a radio button is selected, sets the selected radio buttons as conquered, and then checks for conquered cities and displays the difficulty level of the nearest conquered city.
    void
    dijkstraAction()
    The dijkstraAction function calculates the shortest path from a starting node (Rome) to a target node (Vikings) using Dijkstra's algorithm and updates the UI accordingly.
    void
    initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
    The initialize function sets the music path, updates the army label with the number of available units, and updates the difficulty label.
    void
    kruskalAction()
    The `kruskalAction` function applies the Kruskal's algorithm to find the minimum spanning tree of a graph and highlights the corresponding edges on a map.
    int
    searchCity(int conquered)
    The function "searchCity" searches for a specific city in a list of radio buttons and returns its index.
    int
    searchRoute(City city, City city2)
    The function searches for a route between two cities and returns the weight of the route if found, otherwise it returns -1.
    int[]
    selectedAction()
    The function "selectedAction" returns an array of two integers representing the selected radio button and the corresponding conquered city index, after performing some validations and displaying an error message if necessary.
    void
    setImplementation(Implementation implementationEnum)
    The function sets the implementation type, initializes a map, adds radio buttons and lines to the main screen, and initializes variables.
    void
    setRadioButtonsConquered()
    The function sets the conquered radio buttons in a map if they are selected and disabled.
    void
    surrenderAction()
    The surrenderAction function displays an error alert with a custom title, header, and content, and exits the program when called.
    int
    validateDirectionOfEdge(int city1, int city2)
    The function `validateDirectionOfEdge` checks the direction of an edge between two cities in a graph.
    void
    validateVikingDied()
    The function "validateVikingDied" displays an alert with information about the player's score and achievements in a game, and then exits the program.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      The initialize function sets the music path, updates the army label with the number of available units, and updates the difficulty label.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the FXML file that contains the controller class.
      resources - The `resources` parameter in the `initialize` method is a `ResourceBundle` object that contains the resources for the specified location. It can be used to retrieve localized resources such as strings, images, etc.

    • setImplementation

      public void setImplementation(Implementation implementationEnum) throws exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed, exceptionNoVertexExist
      The function sets the implementation type, initializes a map, adds radio buttons and lines to the main screen, and initializes variables.
      Parameters:
      implementationEnum - An enum representing the type of implementation to be used. It is used to initialize the "implementation" variable.
      Throws:
      exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed
      exceptionNoVertexExist

    • attackAction

      public void attackAction()
      The function "attackAction" checks if a certain number of radio buttons are selected, performs some calculations based on the selected values, updates a label, and calls another function if a certain condition is met.

    • consultAction

      public void consultAction()
      The function consultAction checks if a radio button is selected, sets the selected radio buttons as conquered, and then checks for conquered cities and displays the difficulty level of the nearest conquered city.

    • surrenderAction

      public void surrenderAction()
      The surrenderAction function displays an error alert with a custom title, header, and content, and exits the program when called.

    • dijkstraAction

      public void dijkstraAction()
      The dijkstraAction function calculates the shortest path from a starting node (Rome) to a target node (Vikings) using Dijkstra's algorithm and updates the UI accordingly.

    • kruskalAction

      public void kruskalAction() throws exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed
      The `kruskalAction` function applies the Kruskal's algorithm to find the minimum spanning tree of a graph and highlights the corresponding edges on a map.
      Throws:
      exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed

    • validateDirectionOfEdge

      public int validateDirectionOfEdge(int city1, int city2)
      The function `validateDirectionOfEdge` checks the direction of an edge between two cities in a graph.
      Parameters:
      city1 - The ID of the first city in the edge.
      city2 - The second city in the edge.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value.

    • selectedAction

      public int[] selectedAction()
      The function "selectedAction" returns an array of two integers representing the selected radio button and the corresponding conquered city index, after performing some validations and displaying an error message if necessary.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an array of integers.

    • searchCity

      public int searchCity(int conquered)
      The function "searchCity" searches for a specific city in a list of radio buttons and returns its index.
      Parameters:
      conquered - The parameter "conquered" represents the index of the radio button that has been conquered.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the index of the radio button that matches the specified conquered value. If a match is found, the index is returned. If no match is found, -1 is returned.

    • checkAmountRadioButtonsSelected

      public boolean checkAmountRadioButtonsSelected()
      The function checks if a certain number of radio buttons are selected and displays an error message if the condition is not met.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • setRadioButtonsConquered

      public void setRadioButtonsConquered()
      The function sets the conquered radio buttons in a map if they are selected and disabled.

    • searchRoute

      public int searchRoute(City city, City city2)
      The function searches for a route between two cities and returns the weight of the route if found, otherwise it returns -1.
      Parameters:
      city - The first city in the route.
      city2 - The `city2` parameter is the destination city that you want to search for in the routes.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the weight of the route between the two given cities. If a route is found, the weight of that route is returned. If no route is found, -1 is returned.

    • validateVikingDied

      public void validateVikingDied()
      The function "validateVikingDied" displays an alert with information about the player's score and achievements in a game, and then exits the program.
